i1.name: Flurry
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} After casting an [[champion ability|ability]], '''Lee Sin's''' next 2 [[basic attack]]s within 3 seconds gain {{sti|attack speed|{{as|40% '''bonus''' attack speed}}}} and restore {{sti|{{as|energy}}}}.
The first attack restores {{as|{{pp|20 to 40 for 3|1 to 13}} energy}} and the second attack restores{{ft|half of that amount.|{{as|{{pp|10 to 20 for 3|1 to 13}} energy}}.}}
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: After casting an champion ability, Lee Sin's next 2 basic attacks within 3 seconds gain 40% bonus attack speed and restore energy.
The first attack restores 1 to 13 ‒ undefined energy and the second attack restores
i1.notes: * ''Flurry'' will still restore energy even if the attacks are {{tip|block|blocked}} or missed while '''Lee Sin''' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}, but not {{tip|dodge|dodged}}.

q1.name: Sonic Wave
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' fires a sonic blast in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy it hits and marking them for 3 seconds, during which they are {{tip|true sight|revealed}}.
While the target is marked, '''Lee Sin''' can cast {{ai|Resonating Strike|Lee Sin}}.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Lee Sin fires a sonic blast in the target direction, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it hits and marking them for 3 seconds, during which they are revealed.
While the target is marked, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike.
q1.notes: * ''Sonic Wave'' will cast from wherever '''Lee Sin''' is at the start of the cast time.
q1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '{{tt|{{ap|10 to 6}}|Starts on first cast}}' as '0/8.667/7.333/6/4.667/0' and riot's value '10,9,8,7,6' as '10/9/8/7/6'

q2.name: Resonating Strike
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' {{tip|dashes}} to the nearby enemy marked by {{ai|Sonic Wave|Lee Sin}}, consuming the mark upon arrival to deal them {{as|physical damage}}, increased by {{as|{{pp|key=%|type=target's '''missing''' health|0 to 100 for 11|0 to 100|key1=%|formula=1% per 1% of target's '''missing''' health}}|health}}.
q2.descriptionHtml: Active: Lee Sin dashes to the nearby enemy marked by Sonic Wave, consuming the mark upon arrival to deal them physical damage, increased by 0 to 100 ‒ undefined.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|55 to 155}} {{as|(+ 100% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Maximum Damage|{{ap|55*2 to 155*2}} {{as|(+ 200% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
q2.notes:
* '''Lee Sin''' will track the target if they change locations.
** He will dash to the target's previous location without consuming the mark if the target is too far away or moves beyond the maximum tracking distance (2000 units).
* '''Lee Sin''' will attempt to place himself on top of the target upon arrival.
** The damage dealt by ''Resonating Strike'' can be negated if the target {{tip|blink|blinks}}. Sometimes, '''Lee Sin''' will end the dash at their last location but appear on top of the target after a short delay.
** Originally, '''Lee Sin''' would land 50 units in front of his target. Since there are no patch notes where this is noted to have changed, landing on top of his target may be a bug.
* '''Lee Sin''' will continue dashing even if the target dies or becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, but he will not deal damage.
* ''Resonating Strike'' cannot be cast without the marked target nearby.
* If ''Resonating Strike'' interrupts another dash, {{ai|Tempest|Lee Sin}} and {{ai|Dragon's Rage|Lee Sin}} can be cast during it (both otherwise cannot be cast).
{{ct|attack=false|move=false|cast= [[File: Safeguard.png|20px|link=]] ''Safeguard'', [[File: Iron Will.png|20px|link=]] ''Iron Will'', and [[File: Cripple.png|20px|link=]] ''Cripple'' can be cast. [[File: Tempest.png|20px|link=]] ''Tempest'' and [[File: Dragon's Rage.png|20px|link=]] ''Dragon's Rage'' are disabled.|items=true,,,interrupts,interrupts, false,false,false,melee|consume=true|spells=true,interrupts, true, false|interrupts=death}}
q2.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  30 as 30 and riot's value 50,50,50,50,50 as 50
q2.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '0' as '0' and riot's value '10,9,8,7,6' as '10/9/8/7/6'

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 100% bonus AD)
  • Maximum Damage: (+ 200% bonus AD)

w1.name: Safeguard
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' {{tip|dashes}} to the target allied unit's location. If the ally is a {{tip|champion}}, both they and '''Lee Sin''' are granted a {{tip|shield}} for 2 seconds upon his arrival and ''Safeguard's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is halved. '''Lee Sin''' can [[self-targeted|self-cast]] ''Safeguard'' to shield himself.
If ''Safeguard'' is used, '''Lee Sin''' can cast {{ai|Iron Will|Lee Sin}} within the next 3 seconds at no delay.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Lee Sin dashes to the target allied unit's location. If the ally is a champion, both they and Lee Sin are granted a shield for 2 seconds upon his arrival and Safeguard's cooldown is halved. Lee Sin can self-targeted Safeguard to shield himself.
If Safeguard is used, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will within the next 3 seconds at no delay.
w1.notes:
* '''Lee Sin''' cannot self-cast ''Safeguard'' even while {{tip|ground|grounded}} or {{tip|root|rooted}}.
* ''Safeguard'' can be used on any targetable allied unit excluding [[structures]].
** This includes {{tip|champions}}, {{tip|minions}}, {{tip|ward|wards}}, and [[champion summoned units]] (e.g. {{ai|Noxious Trap|Teemo}}, {{ai|Demacian Standard|Jarvan IV}}, {{ai|Dark Passage|Thresh}}).
* If no unit is directly targeted, ''Safeguard'' will search for wards in a 100 radius to target.
** This aids '''Lee Sin''' in performing the dash to a ward he just placed.<!--because-->
* ''Safeguard'' will not grant its {{tip|shield}} if the dash is interrupted.
** If the dash overrides or is overridden by {{ai|Resonating Strike|Lee Sin}}, he will grant the shield immediately rather than on arrival.
* If ''Safeguard's'' dash interrupts another dash, {{ai|Tempest|Lee Sin}} and {{ai|Dragon's Rage|Lee Sin}} can be cast during it (both otherwise cannot be cast).
w1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '{{tt|12|Starts on first cast}}' as '12/0' and riot's value '12,12,12,12,12' as '12'

w2.name: Iron Will
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' gains {{sti|'''bonus''' [[life steal]]}} and {{sti|'''bonus''' [[spell vamp]]}} for 4 seconds.
w2.descriptionHtml: Active: Lee Sin gains bonus life steal and bonus spell vamp for 4 seconds.
w2.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  30 as 30 and riot's value 50,50,50,50,50 as 50
w2.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '0' as '0' and riot's value '12,12,12,12,12' as '12'

e1.name: Tempest
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' smashes the ground beneath him, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to nearby enemies, marking them for 4 seconds and, if they are not {{tip|invisible}} when struck, {{tip|true sight|revealing}} them for the same duration.
If ''Tempest'' hits an enemy, '''Lee Sin''' can cast {{ai|Cripple|Lee Sin}} within the next 3 seconds after a {{fd|0.1}}-second delay.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Lee Sin smashes the ground beneath him, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies, marking them for 4 seconds and, if they are not invisible when struck, revealing them for the same duration.
If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast Cripple within the next 3 seconds after a 0.1-second delay.
e1.notes:
* ''Tempest's'' sight reveal only reveals the affected targets, but visually also lights up the Fog of War in a 400 radius.
* ''Tempest's'' sight reveal is not removed when ''Lee Sin'' casts ''Cripple'' (unlike {{ais|Sonic Wave|Lee Sin}}).
* ''Tempest'' will cast from wherever '''Lee Sin''' is at the end of the cast time.
e1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '{{tt|9|Starts on first cast}}' as '9/0' and riot's value '9,9,9,9,9' as '9'

e2.name: Cripple
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' sends a wave at each nearby enemy marked by {{ai|Tempest|Lee Sin}}, which {{tip|slow|slows}} them for 4 seconds, decaying over the duration.
e2.descriptionHtml: Active: Lee Sin sends a wave at each nearby enemy marked by Tempest, which slows them for 4 seconds, decaying over the duration.
e2.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  30 as 30 and riot's value 50,50,50,50,50 as 50
e2.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '0' as '0' and riot's value '9,9,9,9,9' as '9'

r1.name: Dragon's Rage
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' {{tip|root|roots}} the target enemy champion during the cast time after which he roundhouse kicks them, dealing them {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|airborne|knocking them back}} {{tt|up-to 800 units|see notes}} {{tt|over 0.8 seconds|Estimated}}, rendering them {{tip|airborne}} for 1 second.
Enemies that collide with the displaced enemy while it is {{tip|airborne}} take {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and are {{tip|airborne|knocked up}} for 1 second.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Lee Sin roots the target enemy champion during the cast time after which he roundhouse kicks them, dealing them physical damage and knocking them back up-to 800 units over 0.8 seconds, rendering them airborne for 1 second.
Enemies that collide with the displaced enemy while it is airborne take bonus physical damage and are knocked up for 1 second.
leveling: {{st|Collision Damage|{{ap|175 to 625}} {{as|(+ 200% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|12 to 18}}% of primary target's '''bonus''' health)}}}}
r1.notes:
* Applies {{tip|spell damage}} to the primary target and {{tip|area damage}} to secondary targets.
* The [[spell indicator]] for this ability also displays the direction for the knock back relative to '''Lee Sin's''' position.
* If the target of ''Dragon Rage'' {{tip|death|dies}} initially on the first hit there will be no displacement of any kind.
* The {{tip|airborne|displacement's}} direction is decided at the moment of impact and not by '''Lee Sin''' and his target's relative locations at the start of the cast (the only way for '''Lee Sin''' to control where his target is displaced is by using {{si|Flash}} before the cast time of ''Dragon's Rage'' ends).
* If the {{tip|airborne}} debuff is removed from the target, its ability to collide with enemies is removed aswell, even if the target has not come to a stop yet.{{bug|2}}
** The airborne debuff and with it collision of the target remains for the normal duration even if its trajectory is {{tip|airborne|displaced}} by another source (i.e - {{ai|Headbutt|Alistar}}).
** The target may still collide with other enemies for the remaining airborne duration after they reach their destination, as the airborne debuff lasts longer than the displacement.
* The knockback distance is intended to be 800, but due to a bug, this is reduced by up-to the sum of '''Lee Sin's''' and his target's {{tip|gameplay radius}}, depending on how far they are away from one another at the end of the cast time.
* The ability will only go on {{sti|cooldown}} after performing the kick.
** Because of this, if {{ri|Electrocute}} triggers from the {{tip|root}} and [[kill|kills]] the enemy, the ability will not go on cooldown.
** If the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, leaves {{tip|sight}}, or dies before the cast time completes, ''Dragon's Rage'' cancels but does not go on cooldown.

effects.str: • Collision Damage: (+ 200% bonus AD) (+ % of primary target's bonus health)

st_slices: (+ 200% '''bonus''' AD) (+ % of primary target's '''bonus''' health)
